answers.author: Jay Gsell

Robin- In NYS we can use Article 72 civil service law procedure to have employee along with his/her job description examined by a specialist of the County's choosing,  not the Employee's own Phys. to determine  fitness for duty and continuation in specific job inaddition to procedures we use for WC return to work and IME's for same evaluation.

answers.author: John D'Agostino
answers.text:
In Massachusetts under Chapter 111F there is language for return to work requiring an examination from a physican of choice (town or employee or one mutually agreed upon) before an employee can come back to work.  While 111F applies to Police and Fire, the concept can be adopted by other communities and applied to whatever circumstance required of your municipality.

author: Robin Weaver
text: Does anyone have some good language re: fitness for duty, not associated with work comp or FMLA but rather associated with employees that we don’t believe are capable of performing certain job duties (eg. some employees unable to operate specific pieces of equipment although job requires it – to date, city has accommodated them by reassigning them to something they can do (eg. asphalt patching crew).  We would like to have employees “tested” for physical and technical job skills if necessary.
title: Public Works fitness for duty language
